intro: Sisymbrium aquaticum, commonly known as water mustards, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. It has a short life cycle, often completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Sisymbrium aquaticum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
